subject: Re: [junit] Instantiating Session before TestSuite runs & destroying 	it at end
msgSnippet: Deepankar, In recent versions of JUnit, you could add the @BeforeClass and @AfterClass to EmployeeTestAMAllTests.  I m doubting that feature goes as far back
messageBody:
Deepankar,

In recent versions of JUnit, you could add the @BeforeClass and
@AfterClass to EmployeeTestAMAllTests. I'm doubting that feature goes
as far back as 4.1, but haven't checked. Can you upgrade?

David Saff

On Thu, May 21, 2009 at 8:47 AM, Deepankar <deepankar.narang@...> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I am currently using Junit 4.1. I have a requirement in which i need to get
> the session before any junit class starts execution. I can not do this at
> @BeforeClass level.
>
> I need to do this at TestSuite Level.
>
> My test suite looks like
>
> import org.junit.runner.RunWith;
> import org.junit.runners.Suite;
>
> @RunWith(Suite.class)
> @...( {EmployeeTest.class,DepartmentTest.class})
> public class EmployeeTestAMAllTests {
> }
>
> I need to instantiate session before EmployeeTest Â and destroy it post
> DepartmentTest. I can certainly write this in @BeforeClass of EmployeeTest &
> @AfterClass of DepartmentTest, but this would not resolve the issue.
>
> I want a generalized solution, in which even if I dont know the starting and
> end Junit classes, the instantiation and destruction process should run
> independently.
>
>
> Thanks In Advance
>
>
> Regards
> Deepankar
